sentences.en: ...a violent slap on the side of the head, which stunned and stupefied him.
sentences.cn: ...他的一边脑袋上猛地挨了一巴掌，使他顿时觉得头晕目眩。

sentences.en: In 1530 it meant to paralyze, deaden, stupefy, to stun or deprive of sensation, as by a blow.
sentences.cn: 1530年，它的意思是使人瘫痪、麻木、失去知觉、昏迷或者丧失感觉，就好像被人猛打了一顿。

sentences.en: Revives someone, especially someone who has had Stupefy cast on them.
sentences.cn: 让人苏醒的咒语, 尤其是对中了麻木咒的人有奇效.

sentences.en: To stupefy with or as if with alcoholic drink.
sentences.cn: 使烂醉因或似因喝了酒而头脑发呆.

sentences.en: When I’ve posted this I’ll go &have a Turkish bath &stupefy my nerves in sweaty duration. My person is developing dirty habits.
sentences.cn: 寄出这封信后我就要去洗土耳其浴，让我的神经在汗流浃背的折磨中麻木一下，我的肉体正在养成不少肮脏的习惯。

sentences.en: You've had another opportunity to try to stupefy me.
sentences.cn: 你还会有机会来愚弄我的.

words.tran_cn: 目瞪口呆的；呆若木鸡的
使人目瞪口呆的；让人昏沉的
昏迷的，不省人事的；无感觉的
使发呆；使失去知觉（stupefy的ing形式）

trans.tran_en: If something stupefies you, it shocks or surprises you so much that you cannot think properly for a while

trans.tran_cn: 使发呆，使昏昏沉沉，使惊讶
